intro: Adenostyles alliariae var. kerneri, commonly known as Kern's narrowleaf cudweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and borne in compact clusters. It is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
